bullets.text: Partial U.S. government shutdown will delay the monthly jobs report, raising near-term data uncertainty for markets and Fed expectations.
Trump says U.S.-India trade deal will cut tariffs immediately; risk-on sentiment lifted Asian equities, highlighting trade policy as a key macro catalyst.
Trump urges DOJ to pursue a Powell probe; perceived political pressure on the Fed could increase policy uncertainty and risk premia.
SpaceX acquires xAI, consolidating Musk’s space and AI efforts; integration could accelerate AI-in-space ambitions but complicates governance ahead of any IPO.
Waymo raises $16B to expand robotaxis internationally, signaling deep capital needs and intensifying the autonomous-mobility race.
Palantir posts another strong quarter on AI and defense demand, reinforcing government-linked AI spending as a durable revenue driver.
Tesla shares fall on weak new sales data, underscoring EV demand softness and margin pressure amid intensifying price competition.
Housing affordability strain is pushing mortgage delinquencies higher, creating downside risk for consumer credit and housing-related sectors.
Court orders restart of U.S. offshore wind construction, reducing regulatory overhang and potentially unlocking delayed capex and supply-chain activity.
Trump announces a critical-mineral reserve; rare-earth miners rally as policy shifts toward strategic stockpiling and supply-chain security.
U.S. and Iranian officials plan talks amid Trump threats, raising geopolitical tail risks for Middle East security and oil-market volatility.
ICE crackdown is hurting Minnesota’s local economy; DHS adds body cameras, highlighting policy-driven labor shocks and rising compliance/oversight costs.
Moltbook breach reportedly exposed millions of API keys, illustrating escalating cybersecurity and supply-chain risk around new AI-agent platforms.
New research argues AI misalignment can worsen with greater model intelligence and task complexity, implying rising safety costs as frontier models scale.
